description.content: Heracule’s shoves can be in any direction.
Heracule’s second effect triggers +1 more time.
You may rush 1 before using Battering Ram.
You can also shove objects with Battering Ram. The object triggers collide effects on the first character it collides with.
If Land Waster’s effect shockwave shoves 3 or more foes or allies, it shoves +1 and stuns your target.
If Land Waster’s effect shockwave shoves 2 or more foes or allies, cure yourself.
Collide: Become unstoppable for the rest of your turn.
If you only shove one foe, they gain hatred of you after this ability resolves.
While you are in the aura, attacks against your ally gain +1 curse.
You and your ally both have have counter while you are in the aura.
Your shield becomes a valid target for allied abilities. You can expend this interrupt to grant them rebound.
Catapult can also be triggered on foes. When triggered on foes, the effect becomes effect: shove 1. Collide: you may rush 1.
You gain 4 vigor the first time in a round this ability triggers.
You can extend the area as a line 5 area effect instead of an aura.
You also have counter while Rook’s aura is active.
You can also inflict hatred on a foe that triggers Rook’s effect, but no more than once a round.
You gain phasing while rushing. Foes you passed through take 2 damage after your movement resolves, and are shoved 1 to either side of your movement.
Allies adjacent to you during any part of this rush are shoved 1 in any direction after this ability resolves.
Exceed: Gain 6 vigor.
You can rush 1 before using Demon Cutter. Charge: rush 3 instead.
If you end your turn adjacent to your thrown weapon, gain vigilance +1.
Yourself and allies that end their turn adjacent to your weapon gain 2 vigor.
Exceed:

subcontent.content: Deal fray damage again to all characters in any area created by this ability.

description.content: Charge:

subcontent.content: Increase range to 5, and all areas may be increased to medium blasts instead.

description.content: You can rush 1 before triggering this ability, and your ally may rush 1 afterwards.
Shove the triggering foe and ally each 1 space in any direction after this ability resolves.
Instead of any rush from Demon Claw, you can gain 2 vigor.
After the second rush, you can shove an adjacent character 2 spaces.
Gain 2 vigor after any time Gates of Hell’s second effect activates.
Vigilance’s range increases by +1 while Gates of Hell is active.
You may also increase the area of any line or arc effects by +1 in Soul Blade, including from this stance.
While in Soul Blade, your attacks gain
tick the die up by 1.
You have counter and are sturdy while inside the area.
Allies inside the area reduce all damage by 2, as if from armor.
Also shove your foe 1 for every charge on the die. Collide: Your foe is stunned.
Exceed:

subcontent.content: Draw a line 4 area effect that includes your target. Characters inside other than your target take 2 damage, once, for every charge on the die.

description.content: Valkyrie gains range 4.
Exceed:

subcontent.content: You are unstoppable and immune to all damage while flying with Valkyrie.

description.content: Charge:
The boulder bounces before landing, dealing 2 damage in a small blast area effect anywhere in range.
Charge:
The boulder bounces before landing, creating a pit anywhere in free space in range.
Comeback:

subcontent.content: Hit your foe so hard that you create 2 spaces of difficult terrain in adjacent spaces after this ability resolves.

description.content: Shove your foe 1, then shove yourself 1 away from your foe.
Charge:
Attack gains Exceed: Also create a height 1 boulder object adjacent to your foe.
Attack gains Exceed: The pit also becomes dangerous terrain.
You may rush 2 or fly 2 before using Takedown.
You can also choose to shove your target 2, then shove yourself 2.
Collide:
This ability deals bonus damage to your target if you land them in a pit.
You can use this ability on allies. If you do, reduce its action cost to 1, they are immune to its damage and statuses, and both of you can rush 1 after it resolves.
If your target collides with another character, you may also shove that character 1 and deal 2 damage to them.
Fly 2 instead.
Charge:
You can voluntarily reduce yourself to 1 hp before using Raging Wolf.
While you’re at 1 hp, increase flight to 3.
While Defy Death is active, all abilities also trigger all exceed effects.
You can rush or fly 1 before using any ability while Defy Death is active.
Deals bonus damage if your foe is suffering from a status.
Comeback:
If this ability only affects one foe, they gain hatred of you.
You can sacrifice 2 after this ability resolves to deal 2 damage again to all adjacent foes.
While this ability’s effect is active, attacks against adjacent allies gain +1 curse.
You can sacrifice 4 to gain or lose a combo token after using any version of this ability.
You can also sacrifice 2 to roll 1 more d6 while gambling.
Comeback:
You may rush 2 towards your hated foe at the start of their turn, but only once a round.
While in this stance, you have regeneration.
Comeback:

subcontent.content: this ability gains range 2. Remove your target and place them into adjacency before activating this effect.

description.content: During the spin, you can cause your target to take damage and phase through objects the same way as characters, though those objects are not shoved.
Comeback:
Your foe also takes 2 damage, once, for every status they are afflicted by when Intimidate’s stun triggers, up to a maximum of three times.
You can sacrifice 2 after using this interrupt to immediately regain it.
Comeback:
Against characters at 25% hp or lower, this ability cannot miss (turn any miss into a hit).
This ability gains range 2 against characters 25% hp or lower and you may rush 2 before using it against those characters.
If you pass through an ally or summon during this movement, deal bonus damage.
Allies you pass through during this movement can dash 1.
Fly 1 after summoning each bomb instead.
Charge:
You can allow any ally in range 2 to dash 1 before summoning a bomb instead.
You can always choose to dash 3 spaces with Spinning Top after seeing your gamble result.
Charge:
If there’s a bloodied character in the area, roll 1 more d6 and choose any result.

subcontent.content: create a pit under your target, and summon a

description.content: Gallows Humor instantly ticks up to maximum if an ally is defeated anywhere.

subcontent.content: deal 4 damage again to any target at 25% hp or lower.

description.content: Increase flight on yourself to 3.
Dazed or blinded foes activate the Finishing Blow effect.
If you haven't acted yet this round, gain evasion after swapping until the end of your next turn.

subcontent.content: If you catch 2 or more foes or allies in the end spaces of the cross, summon a
in the center space if it is free.
Allies in the area can fly 1.
Allies in the area can fly 3.

description.content: This dash gains phasing and ignores movement penalties from terrain.
Before and after the dash, fly 1.
Exceed:

subcontent.content: Gain evasion until the start of your next turn.

description.content: Exceed:
While this mark is active, your attacks gain:
Exceed:
If your target is defeated while marked by Exorcism, the projectiles scatter, dealing 2 damage, once, per charge on the die to all foes in a large blast area effect centered on the foe.
When Trick shot rebounds off an ally or summon, you may teleport them 2.
After Trick shot rebounds, it causes phantom projectiles to split off, dealing 2 unerring damage to all foes at exactly range 3 from its rebound target.
While marked, gain evasion against your marked foe while they are in range 3.
While marked, all attacks from you or allies against your marked foe may gain rebound and deal bonus damage if they are rebounded.
Allies and summons can be teleported up to 4 spaces instead.
Using this interrupt on a foe dazes or blinds them (your choice).
If your attack target is at exactly range 3, they explode with a medium blast area effect centered on them. Foes inside are dazed.
If your attack target is at exactly range 3, you may also teleport them 2 after the attack resolves.
Each time you deal damage with Showdown, you may teleport 1.
When you activate Showdown, gain stealth.
You can consume the area as a free action to disperse the bolts, dealing 2 unerring damage to all foes at exactly range 3 from the center space of the area, and ending the effect.
Marked foes take 2 damage, twice, instead.
At round 4 or greater, Soul Shot considers all characters in the line to be at exactly range 3.
At round 4 or greater, Soul Shot becomes Line 6.
Slay:

subcontent.content: You can sacrifice 2 or consume a
in range 2 of you to gain a combo token after using this move.

description.content: You mark your foe with a dire seal. Shadowy tendrils reach out from an unknown space and jerk them like a puppet.

subcontent.content: You can also sacrifice 2 or consume a
in range 2 of you when marking a foe to also create a pit under them.

description.content: Finishing Blow:

subcontent.content: Teleport all characters in the area 1.

description.content: Slay:

subcontent.content: Teleport 2, then throw knives, dealing 2 damage to up to three foes in range 3.
you or an ally or allied summon in range 2 may teleport 1.
While Umbra’s effect is active, you or allies can rebound abilities off
in the aura. Doing so consumes the shadow, removing it.

description.content: If you swap two foes, you may then teleport them 1 after this ability resolves.
If you swap two allies, one of them can gain evasion until the start of their next turn.
While in this stance, your abilities gain

subcontent.content: This effect can only trigger once a round.

always costs a maximum of 1 movement.

description.content: If you’re in stealth, increase all ranges by +2, and doesn’t break stealth.
While you’re holding Assassinate, you have evasion.
While Nocturne is active, you may teleport up to 2 spaces in or out of the area as a free action.
You may sacrifice 2 when the area is created to increase the size of the area to medium blast, or sacrifice 4 to increase it to large blast.
Incubus gains range 3. If you make it from stealth, gains range 5.
Incubus deals bonus damage for every ally of your target adjacent to your target.
Terrain Effect:

subcontent.content: you summon with a space of dangerous terrain instead.

description.content: If you attack a foe at exactly range 3, this ability gains unerring and you may shove your foe 1 in any direction after this ability resolves.
If made from stealth, increase the dashes and range of this ability by +1.
You and your ally or summon may each shove your target 1 space.
Allies you pass through with Circle the Oak may dash 1 after this ability resolves.
If you passed through two or more allies or allied summons, also gain evasion until the end of your next turn.
Once a round, when you enter or exit the area, you can gain stealth.
Foes in the area count all characters as having evasion.
When you trigger a finishing blow on a foe, you may transfer the mark to them as a free action.
If the beast passes through two or more characters before reaching your foe it deals 4 damage and shoves them 2 instead.
When you first enter this stance, increase the dash granted to 4.
While you have three or more summons in this aura, you have evasion.
While you have stealth, you can create a third underway at any point during your turn as a free action. This underway is replaced if created again.
When you create an underway, you may create up to three spaces of leafy difficult terrain in adjacent spaces. Allies adjacent to underways have cover.
While holding Morrigan, you have cover and ranged attacks against you take +1 curse.
After Morrigan resolves, some of the winged creatures linger, creating two spaces of dangerous terrain in range 2.
Also create a space of dangerous terrain adjacent to your foe after the effect expires.
When the effect expires, your foe explodes with a medium blast area effect, dealing 2 damage to all other characters within.
After Hades resolves, gamble, then all pits in the area explode for a medium blast area effect, centered on them.
Area Effect:

subcontent.content: characters in at least one area take damage equal to half the gamble result.

description.content: You may fly 1 before using Holy, or 3 when charged.
When an ally ends any movement from this ability, they can shove all adjacent characters 1.
You can fly 1, then shove an adjacent character 1 when granting movement from this ability.
After Pandaemonium resolves, gamble. Shove all characters affected 1 space in any direction. On a 4+, shove them 1 again. On a 6, shove them 1 again.
Purgatorio’s damage does not break pacified and its effect causes pits to appear under every pacified foe.
You may fly 1 when Aria’s special effect triggers.
If Aria’s special effect triggers twice, gain defiance and also become unstoppable until the start of your turn.
A swirling aura 1 of winds surrounds you after taking this ability until the start of your next turn, granting you and allies inside counter.
Before you use this ability, you can cause a wind blast, shoving all adjacent foes 1 and dealing 2 damage to them.
When motes explode, they deal 2 damage again to all foes inside and shove them 1 away from the center space if at least one other mote was already exploded this turn.
Allies are cured after detonating their second mote in the same turn.
Yourself and allies inside the aura also have counter in this stance.
Characters cannot critically hit or be critical hit inside Gentleness’ aura, and also cannot gain, deal, or take bonus damage.
You can cause the effect to also apply to foes. Foes that fulfill the condition are sealed.
You can spend any number of blessings on characters in range 2 to roll 1 extra d6 per blessing spent when gambling.
While either effect from this ability is active, your foe takes 1 divine damage after using any ability that damages another character.
While either effect from this ability is active, if your foe defeats any character, they take 1 divine damage three times.
